page.title: 12Local History 1
page.content: {Interview:Mr.and Mrs.E.Smith. Asked about the Dam Close,Mr.Smith said it was an earthworks that had a fence on it to keep cattle in and it probably dated back to Danish times. Willoughby comes from a Danish word meaning "a place by the willows" but it is likely that its origins go back further than the Danes' invasion. Asked about the oldest buildings in the village,Mrs.Smith said the church dated back to the 1400's and was the oldest building.Some of the grave- stones dated back to Saxon times.There was another old dwelling where a famous Elizabethan,Capt.John Smith,was supposed to have been born.The place is now known as Covell's Farm.Weston's farmhouse is also old. {This interview is continued on page {13.}
